example: Smith, A., Brown, B., & Chan, C. (2014). New formations in international business. Chicago, IL: Hoffman

description1: If using a book online that does not have a DOI use \“Retrieved from http:// ... ,\” using the URL for the book.
example: Smith, A., Brown, B., & Chan, C. (2014). New formations in international business. Retrieved from http://www.example.com/

description1: If a publication includes digital object identifier (DOI), use the DOI instead of a URL.
example: Smith, A., Brown, B., & Chan, C. (2014). New formations in international business. https://doi.org/10.1000/182

description1: The authors' names can appear outside the brackets, incorporated into the sentence. Place the date within brackets.
example: Smith, Brown, and Chan (2014) found that ...

description1: Or place the author(s) and date(s) within brackets at an appropriate place within or at the end of a sentence.
example: Researchers have studied how children represent mathematical problems (Alibali, Phillips, & Fischer, 2009; Siegler, 1976).

description1: For direct quotation of fewer than 40 words, integrate the quotation into your sentence. You need to provide (a) page number(s) in brackets for direct quotations.
example: Alibali, Phillips, and Fischer (2009) asked, \“Did the participants adopt the taught strategies?\” (p. 96).

description1: The author's name can appear inside the brackets. When quoting, you must provide a page number.
example: … that cause the biggest breakthroughs for individuals” (Smith, 2014, p. 96).
